Package de.jvstvshd.localstream.network

Interface NetworkManager

All Superinterfaces:
io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler, io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundHandler
All Known Implementing Classes:
NetworkManagerImpl
public interface NetworkManager extends io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundHandler
Network manager for all network operations.
As this is a implementation of SimpleChannelInboundHandler, incoming packets are read in the read method. and then processed useing Packet.process(PacketHandler).
An associated PacketHandler can be set through setPacketHandler(PacketHandler). If no handler was set, Packet.defaultHandler is used.

  • Method Details

    • setPacketHandler

      void setPacketHandler​(PacketHandler packetHandler)
      Sets the packet handler should be used for packets in Packet.process(PacketHandler).
      Parameters:
      packetHandler - a new PacketHandler, which is not allowed to be null.

    • channelOpen

      boolean channelOpen()
      Checks if the current channel is not null and if it is active
      Returns:
      true if the channel is not null and active (Channel.isActive().

    • sendPacket

      void sendPacket​(Packet<?> packet)
      Sends a packet to the other connection participant. If the current thread is not in EventExecutor.inEventLoop(), the packet is sent through Executor.execute(Runnable), it is sent directly if channelOpen() returns true.
      Parameters:
      packet - The packet that should be sent to the other connection participant.

    • close

      io.netty.channel.ChannelFuture close()
      Closes the channel.
      Returns:
      the ChannelFuture returned by the close request.
      See Also:
      ChannelOutboundInvoker.close()

    • addInactiveHandler

      void addInactiveHandler​(Consumer<Throwable> consumer)
      Adds a new listener that gets accepted when ChannelInboundHandler.channelInactive(ChannelHandlerContext) is called.
      Parameters:
      consumer - A consumer for handling the channel inactivity

      PacketHandler getPacketHandler()
